a.xlink:title: Music Genres
Alternative Rock: A broad non-mainstream rock category defined by eclectic influences & a rejection of commercial formulas.
Blues Rock: Rock rooted in blues scales & phrasing emphasizing expressive guitar work & soulful rhythms.
Country Rock: Rock infused with country rhythms storytelling & twang-oriented instrumentation.
Folk Rock: Rock instrumentation combined with folk-style songwriting harmonies & acoustic textures.
Funk: A groove-centered genre built on syncopated rhythms prominent bass lines & a dance-oriented feel.
Funk Rock: Rock fused with funk rhythms emphasizing syncopated bass lines groove & high-energy performance.
Glam Rock: Theatrical flamboyant rock blending catchy pop hooks with bold visual style.
Grunge: A fusion of punk & heavy rock marked by distorted guitars gritty textures & angst-driven lyrics.
Hard Rock: Guitar-driven rock characterized by heavy riffs strong backbeats & an aggressive sound.
Heavy Metal: Loud intense rock defined by powerful riffs high energy & a darker more aggressive tone.
Latin Rock: Rock blended with Latin rhythms percussion & melodic traditions from Latin American music.
New Wave: A polished modern evolution of punk emphasizing melody rhythm & synth-friendly production.
Pop Rock: Melodic radio-friendly rock that emphasizes catchy hooks clean production & broad accessibility.
Progressive Rock: Complex ambitious rock featuring extended compositions technical musicianship & experimental structures.
Punk Rock: Fast raw minimalist rock built on simplicity attitude & anti-establishment energy.
Rock: A foundational guitar-based genre built on strong rhythms melodic hooks & wide stylistic range.
Ska: A rhythm-driven Jamaican genre featuring off-beat guitar patterns upbeat tempos & brass-heavy arrangements.
Soul: A vocal-driven genre blending gospel R & B & pop with emotional delivery & groove-centered arrangements.

Audioslave | Alternative Rock Supergroup | Los Angeles, USA | 2001–2007
A supergroup merging Chris Cornell with Rage Against the Machine’s instrumentalists to create soulful, heavy alt‑rock.

Bad Radio | Alternative Rock Band | San Diego, USA | 1986–1990
An early San Diego alternative/funk‑rock band best known as Eddie Vedder’s pre‑Pearl Jam project.

Class of '99 | Alternative Rock Supergroup | Los Angeles, USA | 1998
A studio supergroup formed to record covers for the film The Faculty, featuring members of Alice in Chains & Rage Against the Machine.

Foo Fighters | Alternative Rock Band | Seattle/Los Angeles, USA | 1994–present
Dave Grohl’s post‑Nirvana rock band known for melodic, high‑energy alternative rock & arena‑sized hooks.

Jane's Addiction | Alternative Rock Band | Los Angeles, USA | 1985–present
A genre‑blending alternative‑rock band mixing art‑rock, metal, psychedelia, & theatrical flair.

Luma | Alternative Rock Band | Seattle, USA | 1989–1990
A short‑lived project featuring members of Mother Love Bone exploring melodic alternative rock.

Mad Season | Alternative Rock Supergroup | Seattle, USA | 1994–1995
A Seattle supergroup blending blues, grunge, & atmospheric rock featuring Layne Staley & Mike McCready.

Novatone | Alternative Rock Band | Seattle, USA | 2000s
A post‑grunge/alternative project featuring former members of Candlebox exploring melodic, modern rock.

Scott Weiland & the Wildabouts | Alternative Rock Band | Los Angeles, USA | 2010–2015
A gritty, guitar‑driven rock project led by the Stone Temple Pilots frontman.

The Mescaleros | Alternative Rock Band | London, UK | 1999–2002
Joe Strummer’s late‑career band blending rock, world music, & socially conscious themes.

Tin Machine | Alternative Rock Band | London, UK | 1988–1992
David Bowie’s hard‑edged rock band emphasizing raw, guitar‑driven sound over his usual theatrical polish.

Unified Theory | Alternative Rock Band | Seattle, USA | 1998–2001
A post‑grunge/alternative band featuring former Blind Melon members exploring atmospheric, melodic rock.

Blind Faith | Blues Rock Supergroup | London, UK | 1969
A short‑lived supergroup featuring Eric Clapton, Ginger Baker, & Steve Winwood, known for virtuosic blues‑rock.

Cream | Blues Rock Supergroup | London, UK | 1966–1968
A pioneering power trio known for virtuosic blues‑rock improvisation & psychedelic experimentation.

Derek & the Dominos | Blues Rock Band | London, UK | 1970–1971
Eric Clapton’s blues‑rock band best known for the emotionally charged classic Layla.

Eric Burdon Band | Blues Rock Band | USA/UK | 1971–1974
Eric Burdon’s blues‑rock outfit continuing his gritty, soulful vocal style after The Animals.

Free | Blues Rock Band | London, UK | 1968–1973
A British blues‑rock band best known for the soulful vocals of Paul Rodgers & the classic hit All Right Now.

John Mayall’s Bluesbreakers | Blues Rock Band | London, UK | 1963–2024
A foundational British blues band that became the premier training ground for future rock legends.

The Animals | Blues Rock Band | Newcastle, UK | 1963–1969
A British RandB/rock band famous for gritty vocals & blues‑based hits like House of the Rising Sun.

The Blues Brothers | Blues Rock Ensemble | Chicago, USA | 1978–1982
A rhythm‑and‑blues revue created by Dan Aykroyd & John Belushi, celebrating classic soul & blues with high‑energy performances.

The Jeff Beck Group | Blues Rock Band | London, UK | 1967–1972
A blues‑rock powerhouse led by guitarist Jeff Beck, known for fiery improvisation & influential musicianship.

The Yardbirds | Blues Rock Band | London, UK | 1963–1968
A British blues‑rock band famous for launching the careers of Eric Clapton, Jeff Beck, & Jimmy Page.

The Flying Burrito Brothers | Country Rock Band | Los Angeles, USA | 1968–1972
A pioneering country‑rock band blending Bakersfield twang with rock attitude & emotional songwriting.

Buffalo Springfield | Folk Rock Band | Los Angeles, USA | 1966–1968
A folk‑rock band featuring Stephen Stills & Neil Young, known for harmonies & political songwriting.

Creed Bratton | Folk Rock Solo Artist | Los Angeles, USA | 1965–present
The folk‑rock musician best known for his work with The Grass Roots before his later acting career.

Crosby Stills & Nash | Folk Rock Supergroup | USA | 1968–2015
A folk‑rock supergroup celebrated for intricate vocal harmonies & socially conscious songwriting.

Crosby Stills Nash & Young | Folk Rock Supergroup | USA | 1969–2015
The expanded lineup adding Neil Young’s edge & songwriting depth to the CSN sound.

The Byrds | Folk Rock Band | Los Angeles, USA | 1964–1973
A folk‑rock band known for jangly guitars, tight harmonies, & influential forays into psychedelia & country rock.

The Grass Roots | Folk Rock Band | Los Angeles, USA | 1965–2003
A pop‑rock band with a string of ’60s & ’70s hits built on strong melodies & polished vocal arrangements.

The New Christy Minstrels | Folk Rock Ensemble | Los Angeles, USA | 1961–present
A large folk ensemble known for polished harmonies & helping launch several major careers.

War | Funk Band | Long Beach, USA | 1969–present
A funk‑rock band blending Latin, soul, & jazz influences into socially conscious, groove‑heavy music.

Red Hot Chili Peppers | Funk Rock Band | Los Angeles, USA | 1983–present
A funk‑rock band blending punk energy, melodic pop, & explosive stage presence.

Arnold Corns | Glam Rock Studio Project | London, UK | 1971–1972
A David Bowie side project used to prototype songs that later appeared on Ziggy Stardust.

Alice in Chains | Grunge Band | Seattle, USA | 1987–present
A defining Seattle band blending heavy metal & grunge with dark harmonies & emotionally intense songwriting.

Alice Mudgarden | Grunge Supergroup | Seattle, USA | 1990
A one‑off grunge supergroup combining members of Alice in Chains, Mudhoney, & Soundgarden for a single track.

Green River | Grunge Band | Seattle, USA | 1984–1988
A pioneering Seattle band whose gritty sound helped shape the early grunge movement.

Mighty Joe Young | Grunge Precursor Band | San Diego/Los Angeles, USA | 1989
The early incarnation of Stone Temple Pilots, blending grunge‑leaning riffs with melodic hard rock before their name change.

Mother Love Bone | Grunge Band | Seattle, USA | 1988–1990
A pivotal Seattle band whose glam‑infused alternative rock helped set the stage for the grunge movement.

Nirvana | Grunge Band | Aberdeen/Seattle, USA | 1987–1994
A groundbreaking Seattle trio whose raw, emotionally charged music brought grunge into the mainstream.

Pearl Jam | Grunge Band | Seattle, USA | 1990–present
A major Seattle band known for emotionally intense alternative rock & a fiercely independent artistic ethos.

Soundgarden | Grunge Band | Seattle, USA | 1984–2019
A pioneering Seattle band blending heavy riffs, unusual tunings, & Chris Cornell’s soaring vocals.

Stone Temple Pilots | Grunge Band | San Diego, USA | 1989–present
A major ’90s rock band blending grunge, classic rock, & psychedelic influences with strong melodic hooks.

Temple of the Dog | Grunge Supergroup | Seattle, USA | 1990–1992
A Seattle supergroup formed as a tribute to Andrew Wood, blending soulful vocals with atmospheric rock.

Adler's Appetite | Hard Rock Band | Los Angeles, USA | 2003–2011
A hard‑rock band formed by Guns N’ Roses drummer Steven Adler to perform GN’R‑era material with rotating lineups.

Camp Freddy | Hard Rock Supergroup | Los Angeles, USA | 2002–2014
A revolving‑door LA supergroup known for high‑energy live shows packed with celebrity guests.

Chequered Past | Hard Rock Band | Los Angeles, USA | 1982–1985
A mid‑’80s rock band featuring members of Blondie, Sex Pistols, & Iggy Pop’s circle, blending punk pedigree with hard‑rock polish.

Cherry Bombz | Hard Rock Band | Finland/UK | 1984–1987
A glam‑punk band formed by Hanoi Rocks members, known for loud, swaggering rock with theatrical flair.

Deadland Ritual | Hard Rock Supergroup | Los Angeles, USA | 2018–2021
A modern hard‑rock supergroup featuring Geezer Butler, Matt Sorum, & Steve Stevens.

Empire | Hard Rock Band | UK | 1973–1980
A post‑Wishbone Ash project led by Peter Banks exploring melodic, guitar‑driven progressive rock.

Guns N’ Roses | Hard Rock Band | Los Angeles, USA | 1985–present
A hard‑rock band blending sleaze, punk attitude, & arena‑sized hooks, becoming one of the biggest acts of the late ’80s.

Led Zeppelin | Hard Rock Band | London, UK | 1968–1980
A legendary rock band blending blues, folk, & hard rock into a powerful, influential sound.

Rapidfire | Hard Rock Band | Los Angeles, USA | 1983
A short‑lived early metal band best known for featuring Axl Rose before his rise with Guns N’ Roses.

The Firm | Hard Rock Supergroup | London, UK | 1984–1986
A hard‑rock supergroup featuring Jimmy Page & Paul Rodgers, known for polished, riff‑driven arena rock.

The Greedies | Hard Rock Supergroup | London, UK | 1978–1980
A short‑lived collaboration between Thin Lizzy members & Steve Jones/Paul Cook of the Sex Pistols.

Velvet Revolver | Hard Rock Supergroup | Los Angeles, USA | 2002–2008
A hard‑rock supergroup combining Guns N’ Roses members with Scott Weiland for a modern, aggressive sound.

Black Sabbath | Heavy Metal Band | Birmingham, UK | 1968–2017
The pioneering heavy‑metal band whose dark riffs & occult‑tinged themes reshaped rock music.

Bullring Brummies | Heavy Metal Supergroup | UK | 1994
A short‑lived project featuring Black Sabbath alumni contributing to the Nativity in Black tribute album.

Geezer | Heavy Metal Solo Project | Birmingham, UK | 1995–2005
Geezer Butler’s solo/side‑project ventures exploring heavy, groove‑driven metal with dark lyrical themes.

GZR | Heavy Metal Solo Project | Birmingham, UK | 1995–2005
Another Geezer Butler project delivering industrial‑tinged heavy metal with a modern edge.

Hollywood Rose | Heavy Metal Band | Los Angeles, USA | 1983–1984
A pre‑Guns N’ Roses band featuring Axl Rose & Izzy Stradlin developing the early GN’R sound.

Ozzy Osbourne | Heavy Metal Solo Artist | Birmingham, UK | 1979–2025
The solo work of Black Sabbath’s frontman, blending heavy riffs with theatrical, larger‑than‑life metal.

Santana | Latin Rock Band | San Francisco, USA | 1966–present
A fusion band led by Carlos Santana, known for blending Latin rhythms with rock, blues, & jazz.

Big Audio Dynamite | New Wave Band | London, UK | 1984–1990
Mick Jones’s post‑Clash project mixing rock, dance, reggae, & sampling into a pioneering alternative sound.

Big Audio Dynamite II | New Wave Band | London, UK | 1990–1997
A retooled version of Big Audio Dynamite that leaned further into electronic dance‑rock & early ’90s club influences.

Blondie | New Wave Band | New York, USA | 1974–1982
A New York new‑wave band that fused punk roots with pop, disco, reggae, & early hip‑hop experimentation.

Cinema | New Wave Precursor Band | London, UK | 1970–1971
A short‑lived pre‑Yes project featuring future members developing early progressive‑rock ideas.

Cowboys International | New Wave Band | London, UK | 1979–1980
A post‑punk/new‑wave band blending art‑rock sophistication with sleek, synth‑driven pop.

Dexy's Midnight Runners | New Wave Band | Birmingham, UK | 1978–1987
A British pop‑soul group blending Celtic influences, brass arrangements, & passionate vocals.

Elvis Costello | New Wave Solo Artist | London, UK | 1977–present
A sharp‑tongued songwriter blending punk energy with sophisticated pop, soul, & country influences.

Elvis Costello & the Attractions | New Wave Backing Band | London, UK | 1977–1996
Costello’s classic backing band known for tight, energetic performances & genre‑spanning versatility.

Fine Young Cannibals | New Wave Band | Birmingham, UK | 1984–1992
A British pop band blending soulful vocals with sleek, dance‑inflected new‑wave production.

General Public | New Wave Band | Birmingham, UK | 1983–1987
A new‑wave/ska‑pop band formed by members of The Beat, known for bright, melodic, socially conscious songs.

The Attractions | New Wave Backing Band | London, UK | 1977–1996
Elvis Costello’s classic backing band known for tight, punchy, genre‑spanning performances.

The Buggles | New Wave Duo | London, UK | 1977–1981
A synth‑pop duo best known for Video Killed the Radio Star & their futuristic, studio‑driven sound.

The Producers | New Wave Band | Atlanta, USA | 1980–1981
A new‑wave/power‑pop band known for tight arrangements & hook‑driven songwriting.

Smith & d'Abo | Pop Rock Duo | UK | 1970s
A melodic pop‑rock duo featuring members of Manfred Mann & The Love Affair.

The Backbeat Band | Pop Rock Supergroup | Los Angeles, USA | 1993
A studio supergroup assembled to record early Beatles‑style rock for the film Backbeat.

The Dave Clark Five | Pop Rock Band | London, UK | 1958–1970
A British Invasion band known for driving beats & catchy pop‑rock hits that rivaled early Beatles popularity.

Asia | Progressive Rock Supergroup | UK | 1981–present
A progressive‑rock supergroup known for polished, radio‑friendly hits built on virtuoso musicianship.

Atomic Rooster | Progressive Rock Band | London, UK | 1969–1983
A British progressive/hard‑rock band centered on Vincent Crane’s Hammond‑driven, dramatic sound.

Emerson Lake & Palmer | Progressive Rock Supergroup | UK | 1970–2010
A progressive‑rock supergroup famed for virtuosic musicianship & ambitious classical‑rock fusion.

Flash | Progressive Rock Band | London, UK | 1971–1973
A progressive‑rock band formed by ex‑Yes guitarist Peter Banks, known for intricate, energetic arrangements.

Harmony in Diversity | Progressive Rock Project | UK | 2004–2007
A progressive/experimental project led by Yes guitarist Peter Banks exploring improvisational, jazz‑inflected rock.

Mabel Greer’s Toyshop | Progressive Rock Band | London, UK | 1966–1968
A psychedelic/progressive band that evolved into the earliest lineup of Yes.

Manfred Mann | Progressive Rock Band | London, UK | 1962-present
British Invasion act that evolved from a R&B pop hit-maker in the 1960s into a progressive rock powerhouse by the 1970s.

The Syn | Progressive Rock Band | London, UK | 1965–1967
A 1960s mod/psychedelic band notable as an early musical home for future Yes members.

Traffic | Progressive Rock Band | Birmingham, UK | 1967–1974
A British band blending rock, jazz, folk, & psychedelia into sophisticated, exploratory music.

Yes | Progressive Rock Band | London, UK | 1968–present
A pioneering progressive‑rock band known for virtuosic musicianship, complex compositions, & soaring vocals.

Adolph's Dog | Punk Rock Band | Los Angeles, USA | 1980-1984
A short‑lived early LA punk/metal crossover band featuring musicians who later joined Guns N’ Roses.

Billy Idol | Punk Rock Solo Artist | London, UK | 1976–present
A punk‑turned‑pop‑rock icon blending sneering attitude with synth‑driven, hook‑heavy anthems.

Deranged Diction | Punk Rock Band | Missoula, USA | 1981–1984
A Montana punk band notable as an early musical home for future Pearl Jam bassist Jeff Ament.

Generation X | Punk Rock Band | London, UK | 1976–1981
A late‑’70s punk band fronted by Billy Idol, blending raw energy with pop‑leaning hooks.

Hanoi Rocks | Punk Rock Band | Helsinki, Finland | 1979–1985
A Finnish glam‑punk band whose flamboyant style & melodic swagger influenced the Hollywood rock scene.

Janie Jones | Punk Rock Project | UK | 1980s
A short‑lived punk‑influenced project named after the Clash song, featuring rotating musicians.

Mad For The Racket | Punk Rock Supergroup | UK/USA | 2000s
A punk‑leaning supergroup featuring members of MC5, The Damned, & Hanoi Rocks.

Neurotic Outsiders | Punk Rock Supergroup | Los Angeles, USA | 1995–1997
A punk‑leaning supergroup featuring members of Guns N’ Roses, Duran Duran, & the Sex Pistols.

Pato & Roger | Punk Rock Duo | Birmingham, UK | 1980s
A reggae‑influenced collaboration between members of The Beat exploring upbeat, socially conscious grooves.

Public Image Ltd | Punk Rock Band | London, UK | 1978–1990s
John Lydon’s post‑Sex Pistols project blending experimental rock, dub, & avant‑garde influences.

Shut Up Frank | Punk Rock Band | UK | 1990s
A punk‑rock collective featuring members of The Damned & other UK punk veterans.

The 101'ers | Punk Rock Band | London, UK | 1974–1976
Joe Strummer’s pre‑Clash pub‑rock band rooted in energetic, R&B‑inflected rock & roll.

The Clash | Punk Rock Band | London, UK | 1976–1986
A politically charged punk band that expanded into reggae, funk, & rock, becoming one of the most important groups of their era.

The Sex Pistols | Punk Rock Band | London, UK | 1975–1978
A seminal punk band whose raw sound & confrontational style helped ignite the punk movement.

Bad Company | Rock Band | London, UK | 1973–2019
A blues‑based hard‑rock band formed from Free & Mott the Hoople alumni, known for muscular, radio‑ready anthems.

Badfinger | Rock Band | Swansea, UK | 1968–1983
A melodic British rock band signed to Apple Records, famous for Beatlesque songwriting & a tragic history.

Bowie | Rock Solo Artist | London, UK | 1962–2016
David Bowie’s ever‑evolving solo project spanning glam, art‑rock, soul, electronic, & experimental pop.

Electric Light Orchestra | Rock Band | Birmingham, UK | 1970–present
A symphonic‑rock band merging Beatlesque pop with lush orchestration & futuristic production.

Elvis Costello & the Confederates | Rock Backing Band | USA | 1980s
A roots‑oriented live ensemble supporting Costello’s explorations into Americana & country‑tinged material.

Elvis Costello & the Imposters | Rock Backing Band | USA/UK | 2001–present
Costello’s modern touring & recording band continuing the Attractions’ punchy, eclectic sound.

Faces | Rock Band | London, UK | 1969–1975
A rollicking British rock band featuring Rod Stewart & Ronnie Wood, known for loose, boozy, good‑time rock.

Fleetwood Mac | Rock Band | London, UK | 1967–2002
A band that evolved from British blues roots into one of the most successful pop‑rock groups of all time.

Ginger Baker's Air Force | Rock Supergroup | UK | 1969–1971
A jazz‑rock fusion ensemble led by Cream’s drummer Ginger Baker, mixing rock, African rhythms, & big‑band arrangements.

Journey | Rock Band | San Francisco, USA | 1973–1987
A melodic rock band famed for soaring vocals, polished production, & arena‑ready anthems.

The Beach Boys | Rock Band | Hawthorne, USA | 1961–present
A pioneering American band known for lush harmonies & innovative studio production that shaped surf rock & pop music.

The Beatles | Rock Band | Liverpool, UK | 1960–1970
The most influential rock band of all time, evolving rapidly from pop beginnings into groundbreaking studio experimentation.

The Dirty Mac | Rock Supergroup | London, UK | 1968
A one‑off supergroup assembled for The Rolling Stones Rock & Roll Circus featuring Lennon, Clapton, Richards, & Mitchell.

The Honeydrippers | Rock Project | UK/USA | 1981–1985
A retro‑styled project led by Robert Plant paying homage to early rock & R&B.

The Iveys | Rock Band | Swansea, UK | 1965–1969
The original incarnation of Badfinger, known for melodic pop‑rock before signing to Apple Records.

The Kinks | Rock Band | London, UK | 1963–1996
A British rock band known for sharp songwriting, distinctive riffs, & influential proto‑punk & Britpop sensibilities.

The Rolling Stones | Rock Band | London, UK | 1962–present
One of rock’s longest‑running bands, blending blues roots with swaggering rock & roll attitude.

The Spencer Davis Group | Rock Band | Birmingham, UK | 1963–1969
A British RandB band known for soulful vocals & energetic organ‑driven hits.

The Who | Rock Band | London, UK | 1964–1978
A powerhouse rock band known for explosive performances, conceptual albums, & pioneering hard‑rock energy.

Tom Petty & the Heartbreakers | Rock Band | Gainesville/Los Angeles, USA | 1976–2017
A heartland‑rock band known for timeless songwriting, jangly guitars, & unpretentious American rock.

Traveling Wilburys | Rock Supergroup | USA/UK | 1988–1991
A supergroup of legendary songwriters blending folk‑rock, pop, & roots influences with relaxed charm.

Wings | Rock Band | London, UK | 1971–1981
Paul McCartney’s post‑Beatles band known for melodic, radio‑friendly rock & wide stylistic range.

Mission Impossible | Ska Band | Seattle, USA | 1983–1984
A short‑lived Seattle punk band notable as an early project for future Pearl Jam members.

Ranking Roger | Ska Solo Artist | Birmingham, UK | 1980s–2010s
The solo & collaborative work of The Beat’s vocalist, mixing ska, reggae, & socially aware pop.

Special Beat | Ska Supergroup | UK | 1990–1995
A ska supergroup combining members of The Beat & The Specials for high‑energy revival tours.

The Akrylykz | Ska Band | Hull, UK | 1978–1982
A British ska band associated with the 2‑Tone movement, known for upbeat, horn‑driven tracks.

The Beat | Ska Band | Birmingham, UK | 1978–1983
A key 2‑Tone ska band blending upbeat rhythms with socially conscious lyrics & sharp pop sensibilities.

Booker T. & the M.G.’s | Soul Band | Memphis, USA | 1962–1971
The legendary Stax house band whose tight, soulful instrumentals defined Southern soul.

JB’s Allstars | Soul Band | UK | 1980s
A British ska revival group connected to the 2‑Tone movement & known for upbeat, horn‑driven tracks.
